item.title: Making podman compose actually work in Ubuntu 22.04.2 (WSL2)
item.description: Having a task to do some pet projects, I decided to containerize it, but run it in wsl2 using podman compose. I expected errors, and of course we had them. The env is as following: uname -a returns: Linux <computer name> 5.15.90.2-microsoft-standard-WSL2 #1 SMP Fri Jun 2 00:45:15 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linu WSL2 (pre-release 1.3.11, kernel 5.15.90.2-3) Ubuntu 22.04.2 (LTS, fresh one) podman 3.4.4, (installed by apt) podman compose 1.
